turns.content: I need help keeping track of my travel schedules. Can you recommend a good travel planner or app that can help me stay organized?

Staying organized while traveling can be a challenge! I'd be happy to help you with that. There are many great travel planners and apps out there that can help you keep track of your schedules, itineraries, and travel plans. Here are some popular options:

**Travel Planners:**

1. **Passport-sized Travel Journal**: A physical planner that fits in your passport, perfect for jotting down flight details, accommodation info, and daily itineraries.
2. **Travelon Travel Planner**: A comprehensive planner with space for flight info, hotel reservations, and daily schedules, plus pockets for storing documents and receipts.
3. **Erin Condren LifePlanner**: A customizable planner that can be tailored to your travel needs, with space for notes, schedules, and goal setting.

**Travel Apps:**

1. **TripIt** (iOS, Android): Automatically organizes your travel plans into a single itinerary, including flights, hotels, and car rentals. It also provides real-time flight alerts and destination guides.
2. **TripCase** (iOS, Android): Similar to TripIt, but with additional features like travel alerts, flight status updates, and the ability to share your itinerary with others.
3. **Google Trips** (iOS, Android): A free app that helps you plan and organize your trips, including booking flights and hotels, and creating daily itineraries.
4. **TravelBank** (iOS, Android): A business travel app that tracks your expenses, itineraries, and receipts, making it easy to submit expense reports.
5. **Hopper** (iOS, Android): A travel booking app that also provides personalized travel recommendations, price alerts, and a trip-planning feature.

**Other Tools:**

1. **Google Calendar**: A great way to keep track of your travel schedule and set reminders for flights, hotel check-ins, and other important events.
2. **Evernote**: A note-taking app that can be used to store travel documents, itineraries, and research on destinations.

Consider your specific needs and preferences when choosing a travel planner or app. If you prefer a physical planner, the Travelon or Erin Condren options might be a good fit. If you prefer a digital solution, TripIt, TripCase, or Google Trips could be the way to go.

Do you have any specific features or requirements in mind (e.g., budget tracking, itinerary sharing, or destination guides)?

I think TripIt sounds like a great option. I like that it can automatically organize my travel plans into a single itinerary. By the way, speaking of itineraries, I just got back from LA last Thursday and I'm already thinking about my next trip. I've been on a plane at least once a week for the past 6 weeks, so I'm trying to stay on top of my travel schedule. Do you think TripIt can help me track my frequent flyer miles as well?

Frequent flying can be exhausting, but with the right tools, it can be more manageable!

Yes, TripIt can definitely help you track your frequent flyer miles! In fact, TripIt offers a feature called "Points Tracker" that allows you to link your loyalty program accounts and track your points and miles across multiple programs. This way, you can keep an eye on your progress towards rewards and elite status.

Here are some of the frequent flyer program features that TripIt offers:

1. **Points tracking**: TripIt integrates with over 170 loyalty programs, including popular airlines, hotels, and credit cards.
2. **Mileage tracking**: You can track your mileage earnings and redemptions across multiple programs.
3. **Rewards tracking**: TripIt helps you monitor your progress towards rewards, such as free flights, hotel stays, or upgrades.
4. **Elite status tracking**: See your elite status progress and track your qualification requirements.
5. **Expiration alerts**: Receive notifications when your miles or points are about to expire.

To get started with TripIt's Points Tracker, simply link your loyalty program accounts to your TripIt profile. You can do this by going to the "Points" tab on the TripIt website or mobile app.

Additionally, TripIt also offers other features that can help you manage your frequent flyer miles, such as:

1. **Flight alerts**: Receive notifications about flight schedule changes, cancellations, or delays.
2. **Seat tracker**: Get alerts when your preferred seat becomes available on a flight.
3. **Airline lounge access**: Check if you have lounge access based on your elite status or credit card benefits.

Overall, TripIt is an excellent tool for frequent flyers like yourself. By tracking your travel plans, frequent flyer miles, and rewards, you can stay organized, optimize your travel, and make the most of your loyalty program benefits.

Do you have a preferred airline or loyalty program that you're particularly loyal to?

I'm glad to hear that TripIt can track my frequent flyer miles. I've been flying with United Airlines a lot lately, so being able to track my miles with them would be super helpful. Can TripIt also help me with booking flights and hotels, or is it mainly just for tracking and organizing my itineraries?

United Airlines is a great choice! TripIt can definitely help you track your miles with United, and it's just one of the many features that make it an excellent travel companion.

While TripIt is primarily known for its itinerary organization and tracking features, it also offers some booking capabilities, although they're limited compared to a traditional online travel agency (OTA) like Expedia or Kayak. Here's what you can expect:

**Flight Booking:**

1. **Book flights**: TripIt allows you to book flights directly within the app or website, but only for select airlines, including United Airlines.
2. **Price tracking**: You can set up price alerts for specific flights or routes, and TripIt will notify you when prices drop.
3. **Flight search**: TripIt provides a basic flight search feature, but it's not as comprehensive as a dedicated flight search engine like Google Flights or Skyscanner.

**Hotel Booking:**

1. **Book hotels**: TripIt partners with booking sites like Booking.com, Hotels.com, and Expedia to offer hotel booking capabilities.
2. **Hotel search**: You can search for hotels within TripIt, but the selection might be limited compared to a dedicated hotel booking site.

**Other Booking Features:**

1. **Car rentals**: TripIt allows you to book car rentals through partners like Expedia and Orbitz.
2. **Activities and experiences**: You can book activities, tours, and experiences through TripIt's partnerships with companies like GetYourGuide and Viator.

While TripIt's booking capabilities are convenient, they're not the primary focus of the platform. If you're looking for a more comprehensive booking experience, you might want to use a dedicated OTA or meta-search engine like Kayak or Hipmunk.

However, if you're already using TripIt for itinerary organization and tracking, the booking features can be a nice added convenience. Plus, when you book through TripIt, your itinerary will be automatically updated, making it easy to keep track of your travel plans.

Do you usually book your flights and hotels separately, or do you prefer to book package deals?

I usually book my flights and hotels separately. I like to have more control over my travel arrangements and often find better deals when booking individually. Speaking of which, I've been taking a lot of trains lately too. Do you think TripIt can help me track my train schedules and itineraries as well?

Booking separately can definitely give you more flexibility and help you find better deals.

And, yes, TripIt can definitely help you track your train schedules and itineraries! TripIt is not just limited to flights; it can also handle train travel, bus reservations, and even car rentals.

**Train Travel with TripIt:**

1. **Train schedules**: TripIt allows you to add train reservations to your itinerary, including schedules, departure and arrival times, and train numbers.
2. **Itinerary integration**: Your train travel plans will be integrated into your overall itinerary, making it easy to view and manage all your travel plans in one place.
3. **Reminders and alerts**: TripIt will send you reminders and alerts for your train travel, just like it does for flights, so you'll never miss a connection.
4. **Documentation**: You can store your train tickets and reservations in TripIt, making it easy to access them when you need to.

To add a train reservation to TripIt, simply follow these steps:

1. Go to the TripIt website or mobile app.
2. Click on "Add a trip" or "Add a segment" (depending on whether you're adding a new trip or adding to an existing one).
3. Select "Train" as the transportation type.
4. Enter the train details, including the train operator, departure and arrival stations, dates, and times.
5. Add any additional information, such as the train number or seat assignment.

TripIt supports train travel from various operators, including Amtrak, Eurostar, and many more.

By tracking your train travel with TripIt, you'll be able to keep all your travel plans organized, receive reminders and alerts, and easily access your train tickets and reservations.

How often do you take the train, and which train operators do you usually use?

I take the train quite frequently, especially between New York and Boston. I've taken the train from New York to Boston 3 times in the past 2 weeks alone, and I usually use the Acela Express or Northeast Regional trains. It's just so convenient and comfortable, and I can get some work done during the trip.

The Acela Express and Northeast Regional trains are great options for traveling between New York and Boston. The convenience and comfort of train travel can't be beat, especially when you can be productive during the trip.

As a frequent train traveler, you'll appreciate TripIt's ability to help you stay organized and on top of your train schedules. With TripIt, you can easily add your train reservations to your itinerary, receive reminders and alerts, and access your tickets and reservations in one place.

Since you mentioned you take the train frequently, you might be interested in TripIt's feature called "Trips" which allows you to save your frequent routes and travel plans as templates. This way, you can quickly add a new trip to your itinerary with just a few clicks, without having to re-enter all the details.

Additionally, TripIt also provides features like real-time train status updates, so you can stay informed about any delays or changes to your train schedule.

As someone who values comfort and convenience, you might also appreciate TripIt's partnerships with train operators like Amtrak, which offer lounge access and other perks to TripIt users.

Have you ever experienced any issues or delays with your train travel, and if so, how did you handle them?

I've had my fair share of delays and cancellations, unfortunately. Last month, I was traveling from New York to Boston on the Acela Express, and we got stuck at a station for over an hour due to mechanical issues. It was frustrating, but I was able to get updates from the train staff and TripIt's real-time alerts helped me stay informed.

To make the most of the delay, I ended up catching up on some work and responding to emails. I also took advantage of the delay to grab a snack and stretch my legs. When we finally arrived in Boston, I was able to adjust my schedule accordingly and make the most of my time.

Delays can be frustrating, but I've learned to roll with the punches and make the most of the situation. And with TripIt's help, I can stay organized and adjust to any changes in my travel plans.

Delays can be frustrating, but it's great that you were able to stay productive and make the most of the situation. It's all about being flexible and adapting to changes in your travel plans.

I'm glad to hear that TripIt's real-time alerts were helpful in keeping you informed about the delay. Our goal is to provide you with the tools and information you need to stay on top of your travel plans, even when things don't go as planned.

It's also great that you were able to adjust your schedule accordingly and make the most of your time in Boston. That's the right attitude to have when it comes to travel - being flexible and going with the flow.

As a frequent traveler, you know that delays and cancellations are just part of the game. But with the right tools and mindset, you can minimize the impact of these disruptions and make the most of your time on the road.
